statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 3 \\ -2 \\ 3 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ -4 \\ 1 \\ 2 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 11 \\ -17 \\ 8 \\ -5 \\ 6 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ 7 \\ -3 \\ 1 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 27 \\ -11 \\ 9 \\ -17 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 3 \\ -2 \\ 3 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ -4 \\ 1 \\ 2 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 11 \\ -17 \\ 8 \\ -5 \\ 6 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ 7 \\ -3 \\ 1 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 27 \\ -11 \\ 9 \\ -17 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5.
